comment: Been using for it for years. Great app!!

author: dave purnell
comment: Found this as a replacement for SqueezeCommander which ceased working for me on Android 6.  Brilliant. Intuitive interface with deep control and reliable performance. I think this app, along with Michael Herger's continued support of LMS will keep my fantastic Squeezebox music ecosystem at the heart of my home listening for many years to come (well until the hardware dies).  Excellent, responsive developer support as well.

author: Jay Fagan
comment: yes, great app except the last update is causing it automatically connect to chromecast which has rendered the app useless. 5 stars when this issue is resolved. (Using my htc one m7 phone) another update today and the problem still persists.  edit:2-26-17~ since the last update, the automatic chromecast connecting issue seems to have been resolved! YAY! So it is back to being my favorite app for squeezebox.

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content:
The automatic casting seems to be bug (or maybe future feature?) Google introduced in a recent update to Google Home or maybe Google Play: https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/chromecast/00b79rIKacA
It is not an error that can be fixed by the app.

author: Rob Ledrew
comment: Used to be able to enter a folder to view it's files in library mode, now pressing the folder name recursively queues all songs to playlist which is not good for me. Searched settings for solution, none found. Assume new bug?

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: You may have encountered a bug on the server.  Do you have more than a few files in the root folder of your music collection? If so, move them into a folder and it should fix your problem.

comment: Downloaded this app as a replacement for the Logitech Squeezebox app which stopped working. After using it for more than a year, I wouldn't go back to the Logitech app. This one is better.

author: Oren B.
comment: Works very well and is easy to use. I use it together with the equally excellent SB Player from the same developer. Both are well worth the money and are incomparably better than free alternatives.  I just wish it had an option to change Previous (<<) and Next (>>) buttons to move back 10 sec, move forward 30 sec, like PocketCasts.

author: Ray Cacciatore
comment: Great controller for my Squeezebox Duet! Love it!  I run 3 Squeezebox players from my Asus tablet, or from my Galaxy S4 phone.  Love the customizable backgrounds.  Always connects flawlessly to my WiFi, always works.  Great app!

author: Paul Gallaway
comment: Best interface for Squeezebox hardware and software players. New sync option is perfect for my use.

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: The Chromecast button should just show up.  You may need to reboot your Chromecast.

author: Bruce Bracken
comment: It just works, and that's a big compliment these days
Works really great. Is there a way to have a 24h input widget for alarm clocks, instead of the 12/AM/PM?

author: John Mansell
comment: Best LMS controller app there is.. Does everything I need it to..

author: Lene Skov Gerken
comment: I can't find the Line In icon? I have a Chrome Cast Audio connected, and it works just fine - on the Squeezebox. But I would really like to start/stop remote!

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: Do you have a Squeezebox Radio? The Line In of the Radio cannot be controlled by the app.  That's a limitation of the Squeezebox Radio.

author: Bryan Shepstone
comment: Perfect control of Squeezebox via WiFi!

author: Gromule
comment: Perfect! :-)

author: Bertram Joseph
comment: Love love love this app

author: Dale Bradley
comment: A good app-Spoilt by "cannot check tablet mode...Go to settings.." etc .Cannot work out to get rid of this pop up on start.HELP!

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: An internet connection is occasionally required to check for the app and tablet mode license.

author: Martin Angell
comment: Wonderful app, does everything I need. Great service as well.

author: Steve Chabot
comment: The LMS controller so far. Well worth the purchase.

author: Paul Hasl
comment: Works perfectly again with my setup. Raspberry pi 3 + hifiberry digi+ + piCorePlayer + Qnap Nas with squeezeserver 7.9.0. Very fast at scrolling through and playing my library of 10k songs. Handles High res Flac files very well.

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: LMS 7.2.2 has never been supported by this app. Lowest version supported is 7.7. It's almost impossible for this app to crash the server, try updating your 7.9 server. 7.9 is technically a developmental version and updates quite frequently.

author: Tim Pointon
comment: This is the best app I've found to control my Raspberry Pi Logitech Squeezebox players (obtained via Max2Play). Free Squeezer nearly did it, but searches for tracks etc. on Tidal gave results matching "Query" instead of the contents of the Query variable inside the app. This app returned query results as expected. And it has great functionality, including a sleep timer. Purchasing a good app makes sense; the challenge is finding good ones before comitting bucks. Cheers!  Update 2017.04.19 : Just installed my 3rd Raspberry Pi (a model 3), this one having a HiFiBerry DAC+ daughter card. With Logitech Media Server running on an old desktop over Ubuntu server, I use this app to control the Pi's. This morning I tried syncronizing two players at different locations within the house ... worked flawlessly!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS APP. Considering the cost of Sonos and Bluesound gear, the price of the app is 'peanuts'!

author: Alastair Pidgeon
comment: Very nice app but has become unstable after Nougat update on my S6. Looking forward to an update...

author: Yuly Milner
comment: Excellent app! Question: is there a way to increase fonts and make them more visible (for in-car dashboard usage)?

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: There is no way to adjust the font size within the app. You may be able to adjust the device's font size.

author: Chris C
comment: Awesome, finally I can control my Squeezebox via Android app again!!!

author: Simon Jehrbo
comment: The app and control is lovely! But the fact that it automatically casts to nearby chromecast is horrible. It constantly tries to cast to some neighbors chromecast that hasn't been setup. It should be possible to simply disable the chromecast part completely. Without the poor chromecast integration this would be a clear 5 star app.

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: The automatic casting seems to be bug (or maybe future feature?) Google introduced in a recent update to Google Home or maybe Google Play: https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/chromecast/00b79rIKacA

title: Nice app, hopeless chromecast integration

author: David Bulluss
comment: Have been using this for a long time now and I love it! Use it on android phones and tablet (with tablet mode). I have one point that may be a bug... on my current android phone, Samsung S6 edge, touching the now playing album cover no longer always brings up the duration bar... it does happen correctly from time to time. I have checked every setting trying to find a switch to turn it on/off but to no avail. A bug?

author: B. M.
comment: Great app for the squeezebox, indeed the best one I could find. Could I make a suggestion? I love using Spotify through this app. Could you add a feature to be able to set a custom home page, meaning for it to start in a certain app (e.g. Spotify) and also to choose a standard service it always applies for search (e.g. Spotify or radio, etc.)

author: Tom Fordham
comment: Initially perturbed by the price of this app I finally purchased after reading other reviews. The app mirrors the functionality of the LMS web interface and maybe adds in some other bits too. Works effectively and is sufficiently customisable e.g. photo background images for different players.

author: Andreas Vögerl
comment: Best app to control Squeezebox players/devices I could find. Have it on my Galaxy Note Edge, Galaxy TabPro 10.1 and Kindle Fire, and it has never crashed up to now. Perfectly controls my Squeezebox Touch, Squeezebox Duet and several android devices running the SB Player app.

author: Graham Knowles
comment: Best squeezebox controller by a country mile!
A pity that the old beautiful icon has been replaced by a rather ugly one.

author: Kasper Nørholm
comment: Hands down way better than any other remote app I have tried. Well worth the price.
title: Best Squeezebox remote

author: Jeremy Fryman
comment: It has a full set of features. Looks nice and the split screen is very good on a tablet. It does not always connect. Squeeze commander does. Also the volume control is a bit small. I blasted my wife with a clumsy fumble. A few tweaks and it will be the preferred controller for my Sqeezebox set.
title: Ok nice on a tablet.

author: Wojciech Bederski
comment: Everything works as expected. No strange crashes or compatibility problems. Tablet mode is nice and reasonably priced. The only small thing missing is support for multiwindow mode on samsung devices.

reply.author: angryGoat
reply.content: Multiwindow mode on Samsung devices is a bit of a hack and is implemented in such a way that would require a pretty extensive rewrite of the app. It just wasn't worth it especially since Nougat added multiwindow mode.

title: Worth every penny

author: Josh Leiderman
comment: App makes livable the fact that Logitech inexplicably abandoned the platform. Angry goat is singlehandedly keeping squeeze alive. Bought sbplayer to show support.

author: Kevin Hyland
comment: Designed from the perspective of the user. I cannot fault it. Spotify searches work perfectly too, if spotify app installed (unlike free controller). Top stuff.
title: A crystal clear app

author: Sharon Rollins
comment: For people still able to use the squeeze box environment this is a wonderful interface. Allows complete operation from a phone or tablet. Flawless.
title: Fantastic controller

author: Alex Munteanu
comment: Best application for controlling LMS, great features !

author: Michiel de Vries
comment: Great interface. Much better as the std. app.
title: Great Squeezebox app.

author: John Kelly
comment: It works unlike many of the other apps.  I like it's usability and look and feel.  Nice features to mute when phone rings.  Worth the money to extend the ease of use for my aging squezebox. If you notice any issues with the app, try replicating the action with the Logitech online remote.  You may find its the player not the remote.  It may just be me, but it seems much more user friendly than the Logitech remote and seems like it allows me to do more actions (or just easier to figure out how to do it)
title: Great app

author: Eric Drum
comment: It has nearly any function I would need. Sometimes it can be stubborn switching from my work server to my home server, but eventually it gets it. For someone such as myself with multiple squeezebox's and servers, this app is the best.
title: Works good
